void getChars (int32_t start, int32_t end, const base::Array< char16_t > &dest, int32_t destoff)
 Exactly like String.getChars(): copy chars start through end - 1 from this CharSequence into dest beginning at offset destoff.
int32_t getSpanStart (ObjectStyle *what)
 Return the beginning of the range of text to which the specified markup object is attached, or -1 if the object is not attached.
int32_t getSpanEnd (ObjectStyle *what)
 Return the end of the range of text to which the specified markup object is attached, or -1 if the object is not attached.
int32_t getSpanFlags (ObjectStyle *what)
 Return the flags that were specified when Spannable#setSpan was used to attach the specified markup object, or 0 if the specified object has not been attached.
int32_t nextSpanTransition (int32_t start, int32_t limit)
 Return the first offset greater than or equal to start where a markup object of class type begins or ends, or limit if there are no starts or ends greater than or equal to start but less than limit.
base::Array< ObjectStyle * > getSpans (int start, int end, const ObjectStyle::SpanType type)
 Return an array of the markup objects attached to the specified slice of this CharSequence and whose type is the specified type or a subclass of it.

Private Member Functions

 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (SpannedString)

Detailed Description

This is the class for text whose content and markup are immutable.

For mutable markup, see SpannableString; for mutable text, see SpannableStringBuilder.

This is the class for text whose content and markup are immutable.

indexthe index of the character to return.

the requested character.

 index < 0 

 or

          int32_t gaia::text::SpannedString::nextSpanTransition 
          (
          int32_t 
          start, 
        

        

          
          
          int32_t 
          limit 
        

        

          
          )
           [virtual]
        

      







Return the first offset greater than or equal to start where a markup object of class type begins or ends, or limit if there are no starts or ends greater than or equal to start but less than limit. 


Specify null or Object.class for the type if you want every transition regardless of type.

          CharSequence* gaia::text::SpannedString::subSequenceN

          start, 
        

        

          
          
          size_t 
          end 
        

        

          
          )
           const [virtual]
        

      







Returns a. 


 CharSequence 

 from the 


 start 

 index (inclusive) to the 


 end 

 index (exclusive) of this sequence.


Parameters:

  

    
startthe start offset of the sub-sequence. It is inclusive, that is, the index of the first character that is included in the sub-sequence. 

    
endthe end offset of the sub-sequence. It is exclusive, that is, the index of the first character after those that are included in the sub-sequence 

  

  




Returns:
the requested sub-sequence. 


Exceptions:

  

    
IndexOutOfBoundsExceptionif 
 start < 0 

 , 
 end < 0 

 , 
 start > end 

 , or if 
 start 

 or 
 end 

 are greater than the length of this sequence.
